Key Arguments: The legislation would restrict freedom of expression, opinion, and speech, which are fundamental democratic rights.
Australia is a signatory to international human rights treaties, particularly the ICCPR, which guarantees freedom of expression.
The Bill would grant ACMA excessive authority over media, undermining freedom of speech and expression.
The legislation could lead Australia towards socialism, communism, and tyranny by enforcing a single narrative.
Notable Quotes: Australia is a democratic country and as such, no Government should have the ability to restrict freedom of expression, freedom of opinion and, more importantly, freedom of speech.
The Bill in its current form, if passed, would allow ACMA substantial, unilateral and discretionary authority to govern all forms of media.
A statement made recently from Robert F Kennedy, Jr 'There is no time in history where the people who were censoring speech were the good guys'.
